title: Look at these strange pictures of a Chinese bootcamp that teaches teens to stop being addicted to their phones
text:
Look at these strange pictures of a Chinese bootcamp that teaches teens to stop being addicted to their phones Parents, please do not make your children put their iPhones in their mouths Military camp can be tough Photo: Reuters 
We all know someone who is addicted to their phone. That is because that 'someone' is all of us. 
However, this is not acceptable for this military camp in China. 
Youths who are about to go to college are forced to go to this camp and un-learn their bad tech habits. 
This apparently includes holding an iPhone between your teeth, which seems kind of unhygienic, and engaging in physical activity. Cellphone-obsessed? Students' #addiction treated in pre-college military training in NE #China 's Shenyang (web pics) pic.twitter.com/halPqkI7Ub â€” China Xinhua News (@XHNews) September 18, 2015 
However, the issue with this camp is that there have been many pictures produced of the bizarre exercises. 
All of which have been posted on Chinese social network Weibo. 
If there was an amazing picture of you doing weird exercises because your mum shipped you off to military camp, the urge to Instagram would be too strong, would it not? 
There is no point undergoing mental and physical strain if you can't even get any likes or favourites on the pictures! In its Q3 Apple sold six iPhones every second At this rate, since you started reading, Apple has sold roughly ... 
We don't think that this would be that effective. 
However, an intervention may be required - people are getting therapy for their iPad-addicted toddlers. 
Apparently students are also equating phone addiction with drug cravings. 
Regardless, this is probably not something that can be solved by an iPhone sandwich.
